intro: Calandrinia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant pink or red flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in dry conditions. Calandrinia heterophylla is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and landscapes.
